definition: to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more

sentences.english: In the Autumn of stop to think about revisiting past through time and space.
sentences.chinese: 在秋光中停留，多想穿越时空昔日重游。

sentences.english: Indeed, a journey through Cairo is a journey through time…
sentences.chinese: 实际上，穿越开罗的旅行是一次能穿越时空的经历。

sentences.english: Traveling Tusi Castle is just like crossing the tunnel of time and space to return that year.
sentences.chinese: 游土司城就象穿越时空的隧道，回到当年。

sentences.english: She refers to a tesseract, a fifth dimension that allows travel through time and space.
sentences.chinese: 她指的是一个能穿越时空的第五维超立方体。

sentences.english: Youare the ones who have come across time and space.
sentences.chinese: 你们是已经穿越时空的一族。

sentences.english: The history of mathematics is wisdom of mathematics through space-time.
sentences.chinese: 数学史是穿越时空的数学智慧。

sentences.english: To go to Pompeii today is to take a trip backward in time.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们到庞贝就是进行一次穿越时空的旅行。

definition: time and place/world of a particular locale and era/(physics) space-time
separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
to meet by chance/to run into sb/chance encounter
ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
